result.execSummary:
The defendant Demarco C Wade was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Firearm by Felon, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs, surcharges and supervision fees.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
No further violations of the law.
No violent contact with victim.
No contact with firearms.

Complete Batterers Intervention Program.
Attend parenting classes.
Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
AODA assessment.  Comply with treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random screens.

supervisions.notes:
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order; and due to DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he must provide a DNA sample, his voting rights are suspended and he may never possess firearms.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Demarco C Wade

records.addlTxt: Per Remittitur dated October 22, 2018, Appeal No. 2016AP001169 CRNM (2015CF000074) and 2016AP001170 CRNM (2015CF001701), IT IS ORDERED AND ADJUDGED by this court in a decision filed on September 7, 2018, that:  IT IS ORDERED that the judgments are summarily affirmed.  See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.21.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney  Brian C. Hagner is relieved of further representation of Wade in this matter.  See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.32(3).
records.descr: Remittitur/Court of Appeals dec & order affirming

records.addlTxt: per order dated September 7, 2018, Appeal Nos. 2016AP1169-CRNM (2015CF74) and 2016AP1170-CRNM (2015CF1701), IT IS ORDERED that the judgments of conviction are summarily affirmed. See WIS. STAT. RULE 809.21. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Brian C. Hagner is relieved of any further representation of Demarco C. Wade on appeal. See WIS. STAT. RULE 809.32(3). IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this summary disposition order will not be published.

Defendant Demarco C Wade in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Defendant Demarco C Wade in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
  Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  Court sentenced defendant to serve a Term of Imprisonment of 8 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prison, consecutive to any other sentence; credit for 223 days served.  Court ordered 4 YEARS Initial Term Of Confinement and 4 YEARS Extended Supervision.
Court found defendant not eligible for Challenge Incarceration or Earned Release Programs.

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- No further violations of the law.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- Attend parenting classes.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No violent contact with victim.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay all costs, surcharges and supervision fees.  The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
 
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence. 
.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon s/he must provide a DNA sample, his/her voting rights are suspended and s/he may never possess firearms.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for 08-14-2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date if still in custody.

Defendant Demarco C Wade not in court, defendant in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case set for sentencing.  Attorney Krejci called and informed the clerk he is having car trouble and cannot appear.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court, defendant Demarco C Wade not in court, in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for sentencing.  Court is in trial and cannot hear the matter.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Statements made by Veronica W.  Court amended the no contact order to a NO VIOLENT CONTACT ORDER.

Defendant Demarco C Wade in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Defendant Demarco C Wade in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNT 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charge dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing. 
.
AS TO COUNT 1:   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Satements made by:  Veronica W.  Court denied the request to modify the no contact order.
Same conditions to apply.
As this is the last day of the speedy trial demand, Court lowered bail to a $5000.00 signature bond.

Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for plea and sentencing.  Defendant has a new case and the plea will not be done on this date.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for April 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Demarco C Wade in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Defendant Demarco C Wade in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  Final Pretrial held.  State is stilling waiting for DNA results.  Case remains set for jury trial on 4/06/15 in Branch 40.  State withdrew their offer to the defendant.  Court reminds defendant the no contact order remains in effect.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Demarco C Wade in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Evan K Glaberson for Michael Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Bail motion by the state argued and denied by the Court.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.

Defendant Demarco C Wade in court with attorney John Matthew Krejci.  Defendant Demarco C Wade in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Joseph Wasserman, under the student practice rule, appeared with A.D.A. for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.    Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #99CF5390 that are attached to the complaint.  Sworn for the state:  City of Milwaukee Police Officer Raymond Brock.    State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for April 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
